title: Generative Modeling with Diffusion
abstract:
We provide an overview of the diffusion model as a method to generate new
samples. Generative models have been recently adopted for tasks such as art
generation (Stable Diffusion, Dall-E) and text generation (ChatGPT). Diffusion
models in particular apply noise to sample data and then "reverse" this noising
process to generate new samples. We will formally define these noising and
denoising processes, then present algorithms to train and generate with a
diffusion model. Afterward, we will explore a potential application of
diffusion models in improving classifier performance on imbalanced data.
